description: From be- (“on, about, all over”) +‎ drip.

verbs.description: bedrip (third-person singular simple present bedrips, present participle bedripping, simple past and past participle bedripped)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To drip about or all over; drip onto (something).
examples: Wine shall break in sparkles o'er our lips bedripping; We are wise, and know we're by it gladden'd!

description: From Middle English bedrip, from Old English bedrīp (“compulsory service rendered to a landowner at harvest time, the reaping of corn on request”), from a compound of bed (“prayer, supplication, religious ordinance, service”) + rīp (“reaping, harvest”). More at bead, reap.
